page.title: 18TRANSPORT
page.content: Barnsley is situated far from the sea but has a good road and rail network. The centre boasts a busy bus station where links to many parts of Britain can be made. Our railway station stands on the main Leeds to Sheffield line and carries both people and freight. Despite the closure of many pits in our area we still counted more coal waggons than any other. The west side of Barnsley touches the motorway (M1) at three intersections and has easy access to Hull, Manchester and London. There is an industrial estate at Platt's Common which is very close to the M1 and has been developed because of this. By comparing maps we have noticed that the roads around Barnsley have changed. Most of the traffic is now diverted away from the centre and that which does enter is channelled one way
